Subjective: Generalized fatigue for ~2 months. Wakes up tired despite sleeping a lot; sleep quality possibly superficial. Onset unclear (gradual vs. sudden). Associated with increased muscle pain, back pain, and morning stiffness. Work is difficult but has not missed days; feels exhausted at end of day. Weekends spent resting. Continues climbing 2-3x/week and cycling without significant performance decline. No lack of muscle power. No shortness of breath, chest pain, palpitations, acid reflux, or specific joint pain. Appetite normal; weight stable at 72 kg. Bowels normal (3-4x/day, smooth). Urination normal. No snoring. Hay fever controlled with medication. FHx: Father with back problems. Social: Active, climbs, cycles. Concern: Worries about an underlying physical problem, specifically rheumatism after online research.
Objective: Vitals: BP 110/60, HR 40-60 bpm. General: Appears well, athletic. Heart: Normal sounds. Lungs: Clear to auscultation. Abdomen: Soft, non-tender on palpation (mildly uncomfortable but no pain), lively peristalsis. MSK: Tenderness on palpation paravertebrally in the lower back. No pain on pelvic compression. Neck and shoulders have full, painless range of motion.
Assessment: Fatigue, etiology unclear. Differential diagnosis includes anemia, thyroid disorder, and inflammatory conditions. Rheumatoid arthritis considered but less likely without clear joint findings.
Plan: Labs ordered: Check for anemia, thyroid function, and inflammatory markers.
Patient to self-schedule blood draw at lab (form provided).
Safety Netting/Follow-up: Patient to call clinic the day after the blood test to schedule a phone appointment for results review and further planning.
